subject: Technology
title: The Remote Control: Power in Your Hand
description: A fast breakdown of The Remote Control: Power in Your Hand for builders.

hook.text: The TV remote was invented because one man hated commercials so much he wanted to mute them from his chair.

buildup.text: Zenith's Eugene Polley created the Flash-Matic in 1955. You pointed a light gun at the TV to change channels.

discovery.text: Early remotes used ultrasonic sound. Jingling keys or a dog's bark could accidentally change your channel.

twist.text: The remote enabled channel surfing, which terrified advertisers. Viewers could now skip their carefully placed commercials.

climax.text: The remote changed viewing from an active choice to passive browsing. We stopped choosing and started channel surfing.

punchline.text: The remote gave us power. We used it to avoid making decisions.

quiz.question: Why was the TV remote control originally invented?
options: Because the creator hated commercials and wanted to mute them from his chair
